ShortName: Deploy IAM Roles on my behalf
Label: DeployIam
Prompt: Allow the QuickStart to deploy the required IAM Roles on your behalf. Otherwise, you will need to pre-deploy these IAM resources before launching the QuickStart; see the Deployment Guide for more details

Label: DeployLogging
Prompt: Deploy centralized logging resources Firehose -> OpenSearch

Label: DeployBastion
Prompt: Deploy Bastion Host in public subnet

Label: EnableEfsBackups
Prompt: Will enable AWS Backups for EFS if "true" (default), or skip if "false"

Label: ProjectName
Prompt: Name of your project. Please use lowercase alphanumeric characters and hypens (-) only.

Label: FQDN
Prompt: URL to use for the project-resources root.

Label: PermissionsBoundaryArn
Prompt: (Optional) Amazon Resource Name of a managed policy in your account to be used as the permissions boundary. This ARN will be attached to all IAM roles created to satisfy your organization's security requirements. If you keep this blank, this attribute is not set. For more information, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/access_policies_boundaries.html.

Label: RolePath
Prompt: (Optional) Path that will be attached to all IAM roles created to satisfy your organization's security requirements. If you keep this blank, this attribute is not set. For more information, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_identifiers.html#identifiers-friendly-names.

Label: QSS3BucketName
Prompt: Name of the S3 bucket for your copy of the Quick Start assets. Keep the default name unless you are customizing the template. Changing the name updates code references to point to a new Quick Start location. This name can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, and hyphens, but do not start or end with a hyphen (-). See https://aws-quickstart.github.io/option1.html.

Label: QSS3BucketRegion
Prompt: AWS Region where the Quick Start S3 bucket (QSS3BucketName) is hosted. Keep the default Region unless you are customizing the template. Changing this Region updates code references to point to a new Quick Start location. When using your own bucket, specify the Region. See https://aws-quickstart.github.io/option1.html.

Label: AITInstanceType
Prompt: Instance type to be used for AIT. See deployment guide for recommendations.

Label: CloudWatchLogsRetentionPeriod
Prompt: Number of days to retain log events in CloudWatch Logs log groups. Increasing this number results in higher log-storage costs.

Label: KeyPairName
Prompt: Name of the key pair that you will use to connect securely to your instance after it launches.

Label: SSLCertificateArn
Prompt: (Optional) Amazon Resource Name of the SSL certificate to use for the load balancer. Use SSLCertificateArn if you are not using FQDN and HostedZoneID.

Label: HostedZoneID
Prompt: (Optional) ID of the Route 53 hosted-zone domain. If you fill in both FQDN and HostedZoneID, this deployment generates an ACM certificate.

Label: AvailabilityZones
Prompt: Availability Zones to use for the subnets in the VPC. This deployment uses three Availability Zones, and the logical order of your selections is preserved.

Label: VPCCIDR
Prompt: CIDR block for the VPC.

Label: PrivateSubnet1CIDR
Prompt: CIDR block used for the private subnet located in Availability Zone 1.

Label: PrivateSubnet2CIDR
Prompt: CIDR block used for the private subnet located in Availability Zone 2.

Label: PrivateSubnet3CIDR
Prompt: CIDR block used for the private subnet located in Availability Zone 3.

Label: RemoteAccessCIDR
Prompt: CIDR IP range that is permitted to access the instances. Set this value to a trusted IP range.

Label: PublicSubnet1CIDR
Prompt: CIDR block used for the public subnet located in Availability Zone 1.

Label: PublicSubnet2CIDR
Prompt: CIDR block used for the public subnet located in Availability Zone 2.

Label: PublicSubnet3CIDR
Prompt: CIDR block used for the public subnet located in Availability Zone 3.

ShortName: ID of preconfigured security group in an existing VPC
Label: AccessSgID
Prompt: (Optional) If you're deploying into an existing VPC, fill in the ID of the preconfigured security group to control access to the Application Load Balancer.

ShortName: ID for VPC in an existing VPC
Label: VpcId
Prompt: (Optional) If you're deploying into an existing VPC, fill in the VPC ID.

Label: PrivateSubnet1CIDR
Prompt: CIDR block used for the private subnet located in Availability Zone 1.

Label: PrivateSubnet2CIDR
Prompt: CIDR block used for the private subnet located in Availability Zone 2.

Label: PrivateSubnet3CIDR
Prompt: CIDR block used for the private subnet located in Availability Zone 3.

Label: RemoteAccessCIDR
Prompt: CIDR IP range that is permitted to access the instances. Set this value to a trusted IP range.

Label: PrivateSubnet1CIDR
Prompt: CIDR block used for the private subnet located in Availability Zone 1.
